definition: photogenic/to appear on film or in the media
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: She's camera-shy and hates being photographed.
sentences.chinese: 她怕上鏡，因此不願意讓別人給她拍照。

sentences.english: He is a photogenic monster with good hygiene.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個有着良好衛生習慣又上鏡的怪物。

sentences.english: My younger sister has a photogenic face.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹有一張很上鏡頭的臉。

sentences.english: Can I ask you a question why I am always the green leaves when you look so good in the picture?!
sentences.chinese: 請問爲什麼您每次上鏡的時候，都顯得我是綠葉子嗎？

sentences.english: She's very photogenic so the camera just loves her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常上鏡頭所以大家的照相機都喜歡拍她。

sentences.english: EX:I have to make sure thtowards I was photogenic.
sentences.chinese: 我必須確定我很上鏡頭。

sentences.english: The Chinese want a champion who is photogenic.
sentences.chinese: 中國人想要一個上鏡的冠軍。

sentences.english: Ms Obama is the more outspoken, but with two young children each, both are equally photogenic.
sentences.chinese: 但她們都各自有一雙年幼的孩子，而且一樣的上鏡。

sentences.english: EX:I have to make sure that I am photogenic.
sentences.chinese: 我必須確定我很上鏡頭。

definition: to act in a play/to put on a play
visually attractive/eye candy/easy on the eyes/to protect the eyes
to show one's face/to make one's good name/to become successful and well known/to shine

(of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
